message: OCaml files should provide license information in second line (structure item)
Prefer guard instead of if-then-else in case construction

Eta reduction proposed. It's recommended to rewrite 'fun subst ->
                                                       fun v ->
                                                         Map.find subst v' as 
'Map.find'

Eta reduction proposed. It's recommended to rewrite 'fun subst ->
                                                       fun v ->
                                                         Map.remove subst v' as 
'Map.remove'

Eta reduction proposed. It's recommended to rewrite 'fun t1 ->
                                                       fun t2 -> unify t1 t2' as 
'unify'

Eta reduction proposed. It's recommended to rewrite 'fun env ->
                                                       fun key ->
                                                         Map.find env key' as 
'Map.find'

Using `failwith` (or `assert false`) usually is a clue that a corner case is not being handled properly. To report errors we recommend using error monad instead. In princliple, these construction are OK for temporary work-in-progress code, but in release they should be eliminated
